attributes.action: Any deal negotiated by parliament must be put to the people before ratification.
attributes.additional_details: It’s essential that any deal negotiated in parliament would be better than the deal we currently have with the EU at the present time. Therefore it makes sense that any Brexit deal should be put before the very people it will effect on a day to day basis in order to give a mandate for its approval and implementation.
attributes.background: Parliament have been in gridlock with regards to a deal over Brexit for far too long with many different opinions and views beings offered. In order to make sure the public agree with any deal parliament eventually agreed on, it must be put back before the people in a confirmatory referendum.
